The original Hypnospace Outlaw earned praise for its nostalgic 1999 internet simulation, described by critics as 'a brilliantly observed snapshot of the primordial web' featuring hundreds of explorable pages across eccentric community zones. Dreamsettler was envisioned as expanding this universe into a 2000s web environment.

fields.title: Stormgate Finally Introduces Namesake Feature Nearly a Year After Launch
fields.summary: Frost Giant Studios has added the long-requested 'stormgates' gameplay feature to their RTS title Stormgate after nearly a year since launch, fulfilling a core promise implied by the game's name.
fields.content:
Nearly a year following its release, Frost Giant's real-time strategy game Stormgate has received its namesake feature - stormgates. The addition comes after initial criticism regarding the game's lack of polish, limited single-player content, and absence of this central element.

Frost Giant acknowledged the oversight in a recent Steam blog, stating: "We called the game Stormgate, yet we didn't actually have any stormgates." The studio described the new feature as "obvious, long-requested, and in-your-face fun" enough to warrant naming the entire game after it.

Stormgates are dimensional rifts created by arcane storms that appear strategically on 1v1 maps. Players send units to unlock these gates, receiving randomized rewards designed to dramatically alter gameplay rather than providing minor stat boosts. These include abilities like temporary speed boosts for nearby troops, resurrection of units in surrounding areas, and structural damages to enemy buildings.

During testing, developers observed players completely adapting strategies around stormgates—rerouting attacks, splitting armies, and executing complex tactical maneuvers to control them. Frost Giant intends stormgates to replace unpopular 'creep camps' (AI-controlled outposts), which have now been removed from competitive ladder maps due to community feedback.

The stormgate feature is currently active in 1v1 matches and will expand to other game modes soon. This update follows Frost Giant's April overhaul of the game's campaign, which included narrative rewrites and mission restructuring.

fields.title: Once Human Launches Custom Servers with Extensive Tweakable Options
fields.summary: Developer NetEase has introduced custom, dedicated servers for multiplayer survival game Once Human, allowing players to create personalized gameplay experiences with adjustable parameters including resource rates, building mechanics, and PvP/PvE modes.
fields.content:
Once Human, the free-to-play survival adventure shooter, has officially launched custom dedicated servers supported by developer NetEase Games. Players can now create personalized gameplay environments tailored to different playstyles, from relaxing building-focused experiences to intense survival challenges.

Private server administrators can switch between all official PvE and PvP scenarios while customizing numerous gameplay parameters. These include weather patterns, day-night cycle dynamics, character attributes, experience modifiers, resource respawn rates, and building construction and maintenance settings. Server purchases and management are handled through an in-game interface.

All private server data remains separate from the main game's backend, with administrators controlling access permissions. NetEase plans to expand features by adding mod support and specialized private server scenarios in future updates. The developer also announced a major 2.0 update reveal scheduled for July 2 via YouTube stream, featuring a new roadmap, upcoming scenarios, gameplay enhancements, and details about the PvP spinoff Once Human: Raidzone launching this July.

fields.title: Pathologic 3 embraces time travel mechanics to redefine player failure
fields.summary: Pathologic 3's gameplay overhaul centers on time travel mechanics that let players undo mistakes, shifting from Pathologic 2's punishing structure to empower experimentation with narrative-altering choices through Amalgam resource gathering and Mind Map decision tracking.
fields.content:
Pathologic 2's unrelenting difficulty deterred some players despite critical acclaim, with concerns about investing hours into inevitable failure. Developer Ice-Pick Lodge now flips this concept entirely in Pathologic 3, restructuring the experience around time travel mechanics rather than gradual decline.

The narrative begins at protagonist Dankovsky's point of total failure after catastrophic plague measures – enforced quarantines, neighborhood burnings, and heavy-handed punishments. Framed as an interrogation scene, players must justify this collapse while gaining tools to rewrite history.

The Amalgam System

A substance called Amalgam enables players' time jumps, earned by completing quests, breaking mirrors, or euthanizing terminal patients. This resource permits revisiting previous days to alter pivotal moments. For example, leaping from Day 5 to Day 3 to rescue a dying character then returning to view the changed timeline.

Mind Mapping Choices

Decision impacts become visible through the Mind Map interface, illustrating narrative connections while allowing isolated adjustments. Players can alter specific choices without redoing entire days, preserving unrelated outcomes unless logical dependencies exist. Designer Nikolay Dybowski explained the goal during development: "What if any mistake could be undone?"

Despite eliminating forced failure, difficult moral ambiguity remains core to Pathologic 3. The studio confirmed there will be few obviously good or bad choices, with critical story paths and endings locked behind specific chains of causality. The time-warping mechanics intend to encourage bold experimentation rather than reliance on guides.

fields.title: Blasphemous Slashed by 90% in Massive Team17 Sale
fields.summary: The dark fantasy action game Blasphemous is available at 90% off, dropping to just $2.50 during Team17's publisher sale. The sequel Blasphemous 2 is also discounted at 50% off alongside other titles like Dredge and Overcooked.
fields.content:
Team17's week-long publisher sale features major discounts on popular titles, including Dredge at half-price and Overcooked at 80% off. The standout offer is The Game Kitchen's gothic action-platformer Blasphemous, currently reduced by 90% to $2.50 (£2.00).

At this price point, Blasphemous costs less than a bus ticket or coffee while offering 14 hours of gameplay featuring bizarre encounters like battling a giant baby wearing a crown of thorns. A 2019 review described the experience: 'Every moment in Blasphemous is unsettling and my morbid curiosity dragged me from screen to screen. The world is horrible and it's all the more compelling.'

Though the combat shows limitations from its 2D perspective and platforming can be unforgiving, these flaws are easily overlooked given the extraordinarily low price.

Sequel Discounts

Blasphemous 2 is simultaneously discounted at 50% off, priced at $15 (£11.24). While not as drastic as the original's reduction, this offers savings on last year's expanded title known for refining the original formula with more content and bosses.

Notably, Blasphemous 2 received a major free update in 2023 that increased gameplay content by 40% and added New Game Plus mode, alongside a paid expansion. Both discounts and Team17's publisher sale conclude this Thursday.

fields.title: Denmark Shifts Government Systems to Linux for Digital Sovereignty
fields.summary: Denmark's Ministry of Digital Affairs announces a major transition from Windows and Office 365 to Linux and LibreOffice this summer, citing digital sovereignty concerns and reducing dependency on foreign suppliers.
fields.content:
Denmark will migrate half of its Ministry of Digital Affairs from Windows and Office 365 to Linux and LibreOffice this summer, according to officials. The Scandinavian nation seeks greater control over its digital infrastructure with this strategic shift.

Danish newspaper Politiken reported the ministry's decision stems from concerns about over-reliance on external technology providers. With a population of approximately 6 million, Denmark ranks among Europe's economic leaders and top global performers in per capita wealth.

"It's not about isolation or digital nationalism," Digital Affairs Minister Caroline Stage Olsen explained in a LinkedIn statement. "But we must avoid dependency on so few suppliers that limits our freedom. Much of our public digital infrastructure is currently vulnerable due to concentrated foreign providers."

The initiative positions Denmark among a growing number of governments diversifying operating systems. While Windows maintained long-standing dominance in previous decades, experts note technology landscapes continually evolve and transition between platforms may become increasingly common.

As an example of shifting technology habits, the minister referenced how devices like the Steam Deck demonstrate how users may gradually embrace alternatives without formal declarations.

fields.title: Optimal Arbites Build for Warhammer 40K: Darktide
fields.summary: A powerful melee-focused Arbites build for Darktide that forgoes the Cyber-Mastiff companion in favor of higher damage output and versatility, featuring weapon recommendations, talent synergies, and combat strategies.
fields.content:
Warhammer 40K: Darktide's Arbites class delivers intense Judge Dredd-inspired gameplay with visceral melee combat. After extensive testing, this melee-centric build proves exceptionally effective, capable of handling Heresy-difficulty missions solo with bots and excelling in team play.

Core Build Philosophy

This build intentionally omits the Cyber-Mastiff companion to leverage the Lone Wolf talent. Sacrificing the dog unlocks significant bonuses: +15% toughness damage reduction, +10% attack speed, +10% damage, five grenades, and grenade regeneration every 60 seconds. Melee combat forms the foundation, focusing on staggering enemies through precise weak-spot hits.

Recommended Weapons

The Branx Mk III Shock Maul outperforms alternatives with its rapid attacks and electric special ability that stuns enemies. Ideal blessings include Execution (+50% damage to staggered foes) and High Voltage (electrifying critical hits). The Exterminator Shotgun complements the build by clearing hordes and generating Melee Justice stacks - granting +15% melee damage per stack when switching to the maul.

Shotgun blessings should prioritize Fire Frenzy (damage bonus after multiple hits) and Speedload (faster reloads). Both weapons synergize with Terminus Warrant mechanics - ranged attacks build melee buffs while melee strikes enhance ranged capabilities.

Talent Synergies

Critical talents include Concussive (4-second stagger on weak-spot hits), Lone Wolf (dog replacement bonuses), and Inspiring Recitation which upgrades the Nuncio-Aquila ability to provide team-wide 30% toughness reduction and attack speed. Weight of the Lex adds 15% damage after heavy attacks, while Zealous Dedication boosts critical chance on kills.

The Terminus Warrant system creates dynamic combat flow: shotgun blasts against groups build Melee Justice for the Shock Maul, while melee strikes accumulate Ranged Justice for shotgun enhancements. The Nuncio-Aquila becomes a game-saving tool during boss fights or overwhelming ranged encounters.

Combat Strategies

Prioritize headshots with the Shock Maul to trigger staggers and damage bonuses. Alternate between weapon sets frequently to maintain buff stacks - use the shotgun against groups before engaging tougher enemies in melee. Conserve grenades for critical moments since they regenerate. Utilize the enhanced dodging from Street Smarts and toughness regeneration from Walk It Off stamina usage.

During ultimates, plant the Nuncio-Aquila in chokepoints to create survivability zones with toughness regeneration and damage amplification. Heavy attacks efficiently spend Melee Justice stacks against elites, while the maul's special attack neutralizes dangerous foes like Ragers.

fields.title: Death Stranding 2 Release Schedule Explained for PS5 Launch
fields.summary: Hideo Kojima's Death Stranding 2 arrives with a complex global launch schedule. This guide details regional release timings, early access options for PS5, preload availability, and PC release expectations.
fields.content:
Death Stranding 2, Hideo Kojima's highly anticipated sequel, launches with industry-wide attention despite its current PlayStation 5 exclusivity. The game features an unconventional narrative described as both provocative and emotionally detached.

The global release operates on a unique "rolling midnight" schedule causing some confusion. This system activates the game at midnight in each region's easternmost time zone, with western zones gaining earlier access on the same calendar day according to Sony's regional divisions.

Standard Edition launch schedule

Region definitions remain partially unclear, though New Zealand serves as Oceania's reference point and the US East Coast anchors North America. European and Asian regional boundaries are unspecified under this rollout approach. Discrepancies exist between reports, with some suggesting this time-shifted launch applies only to North America while others claim global implementation.

Early Access timing

Digital Deluxe Edition owners receive 48-hour early access starting at exactly the same regional times as the standard launch window. This provides a two-day head start before the wider release.

Preloading availability

PS5 players can currently preload Death Stranding 2 in preparation for launch, allowing immediate access when release times activate in their region.

PC release status

No simultaneous PC release is planned. Based on the original game's eight-month gap between PlayStation and PC launches, a similar delay is expected for the sequel's PC version.

fields.title: Grim Dawn's Fangs of Asterkarn Expansion to Feature 54 Bosses and 380+ New Items
fields.summary: Crate Entertainment's upcoming Grim Dawn expansion Fangs of Asterkarn will be the ARPG's largest yet, spanning 3.55sq km with 54 new bosses, over 380 unique items, and major technical advancements.
fields.content:
Amid ongoing debates about popular action RPGs like Path of Exile 2 and Diablo 4, developer Crate Entertainment revealed surprising details about Grim Dawn's forthcoming expansion Fangs of Asterkarn. Announced unexpectedly in 2023, this third expansion is now confirmed as the game's largest content addition to date, with the extended development period attributed to its unprecedented scale.

Lead designer Kamil 'Zantai' Marczewski provided exact measurements for the new territory: "Fangs of Asterkarn will cover approximately 3.55sq km, making it 110% as big as Ashes of Malmouth." The expansion's central hub Kurnhold spans four distinct zones compared to the 1.5 zones that composed Forgotten Gods' Covenant of the Three area.

When compared to previous expansions, Asterkarn's map notably exceeds both Forgotten Gods' 2.5sq km area and Ashes of Malmouth's 3.2sq km framework. The expansion includes 54 new boss encounters, featuring eight formidable Nemesis battles. Marczewski emphasized technical improvements, noting: "These bosses showcase our most advanced skill tech yet as we push this aging engine to its absolute limits."

Loot enthusiasts will discover more than 380 new Unique items and 120 new Monster Infrequents specialized for distinct builds, not including Awakened Epic items or Ascended common drops. The developer confirmed this brings "the most unique assets, animations, and creatures we've ever developed" to the decade-old ARPG.

Crate Entertainment outlined a tentative release window of late Fall or Winter 2025, while acknowledging possible delays into Spring or early Summer 2026 for additional polishing. The team emphasized their commitment to quality despite the prolonged timeline, inviting players to anticipate Titan Quest 2 in the interim period.

fields.title: Lies of P Developers Rewarded for Successful DLC with Bonuses and Vacation
fields.summary: Developer Round8 Studio and publisher Neowiz have rewarded their teams with $7,300 bonuses, extra vacation, and Switch 2 consoles following the critical and commercial success of the Lies of P: Overture DLC, a rare positive outcome in the game industry.
fields.content:
In a refreshing departure from industry trends, the developers behind Lies of P: Overture have been substantially rewarded for their successful work. This outcome shines as uncommon good news in a sector where job security remains unstable regardless of project quality.

According to a Korean news report by Thelec, the recent DLC expansion has sold exceptionally well, moving approximately three million copies. To celebrate this achievement, publisher Neowiz is granting all staff at developer Round8 Studio and its internal Lies of P division a $7,300 bonus—equivalent to 10 million South Korean won—along with two additional weeks of paid vacation and a Nintendo Switch 2 console.

The rewards recognize both commercial success and critical reception. Lies of P: Overture currently holds a 'Very Positive' user rating on Steam and has achieved an 84 Metascore alongside a 7.5 user score on Metacritic.

This positive outcome contrasts sharply with frequent industry patterns, where even well-received games can lead to layoffs. The report serves as a hopeful counterpoint to the prevalent industry saying that 'making good, profitable games will no longer keep you safe.'

While acknowledging ongoing challenges in game development, this gesture marks a welcome exception. Observers noted that such rewards should become standard practice rather than extraordinary occurrences in the gaming world.

fields.title: England Launches Urgent Inquiry into Maternity Care Failings
fields.summary: The UK government has announced a rapid national investigation into failing maternity services across England following years of scandals, pledging urgent reviews of the worst-performing units and systemic reforms to prevent future harm.
fields.content:
Health Secretary Wes Streeting has launched a nationwide investigation into maternity and neonatal care in England, declaring immediate action essential. The rapid inquiry will urgently examine the country's worst-performing services and is scheduled to deliver findings by December 2025.

Meeting parents affected by maternity scandals across various NHS trusts, Streeting committed to securing truth and accountability. He stated: "We must make sure these families get the truth and the accountability they deserve," adding his goal is to ensure "no parent or baby is ever let down again." Multiple reports over the past decade have uncovered failing maternity services at trusts including Morecambe Bay, Shrewsbury & Telford, and Nottingham.

Streeting described meeting families suffering from "devastating... trauma, loss, and lack of basic compassion" during maternity care. Noting that most births remain safe, he emphasized: "It's clear something is going wrong. Their bravery in speaking out has made it clear: we must act – and we must act now." The Health Secretary formally apologized to families for NHS failures on behalf of the health service.

Systemic reforms planned

The two-phase investigation will start with urgent reviews of up to 10 severely underperforming maternity units this summer, focusing on facilities where families raised concerns. University Hospitals Sussex and Leeds Teaching Hospitals are confirmed for examination. The second stage implements nationwide reforms based on previous inquiries, establishing uniform safety standards across all maternity services.

Concurrently, an anti-discrimination initiative will tackle healthcare inequalities after data revealed maternal mortality rates nearly triple for Black women and double for Asian women compared to white women. Since 2009, overall maternal deaths in England have increased by 27% - against government targets of a 50% reduction.

Leaders from baby loss charity Sands called the probe "much-needed and long-overdue," while campaigner Rhiannon Davies - whose daughter died in 2009 - welcomed it but urged expansion across the UK. Solicitor Anne Kavanagh stressed this must yield tangible changes, noting past recommendations "had not been fully implemented".

fields.title: Crucial NATO Summit as Trump Returns Amid Global Tensions
fields.summary: NATO leaders prepare for what may be the alliance's most pivotal summit since the Cold War as Donald Trump returns amid demands for increased defense spending and heightened global security threats.
fields.content:
US President Donald Trump is set to attend a critical NATO summit in the Netherlands following recent U.S. airstrikes on Iranian nuclear facilities. This marks his first alliance meeting since re-election, with leaders anxious about his past criticisms of member states' defense spending. Diplomats revealed that strained relations had initially cast doubt on Trump's attendance. "With Russia and China watching for western weakness, that would have been a disaster," one high-level official stated anonymously.

Spending Demands and Summit Uncertainties

NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte structured the summit around Trump's demand for higher defense budgets, aiming to secure commitments reaching 5% of GDP. The strategy intended to demonstrate European self-reliance while avoiding contentious topics. However, this carefully crafted plan faces disruption; Middle East tensions could force Trump to cancel or dominate discussions. Ironically, Trump suggested European nations bear the burden: "I don't think we should, but I think that the NATO countries should, absolutely," he declared.

Europe's Defense Dependencies

Europe's security relies heavily on American resources, including 100,000 U.S. troops stationed across the continent, nuclear weapons in Italy, Belgium, Germany and the Netherlands, and critical intelligence capabilities. "Europe has depended on Washington for command structures we can't quickly replicate," explained Malcolm Chalmers of RUSI. Analysts note that transfer of U.S. assets to Asia could create critical gaps, compelling NATO members to develop independent capacities like extending France's nuclear deterrence.

The Heavy Price of Rearmament

To meet the 5% spending target, NATO proposes dividing contributions into 3.5% on direct defense and 1.5% on supporting infrastructure. Nations face difficult choices between increasing taxes, borrowing, or cutting social programs - known as "tanks or pensions" economics. Poland leads compliance at 4.7% GDP spending, while Spain risks government collapse over budget disputes. Rutte warns that Russia could attack NATO within five years, making the proposed 7-10 year spending timeline potentially too slow.

European leaders anxiously await Trump's decisions regarding Ukraine funding and potential troop withdrawals from Eastern Europe. While some view the summit as historic for spurring European defense investment, outcomes remain uncertain. As one diplomat stated: "This could be the most significant NATO summit since the Cold War" - defining Europe's security future in an increasingly volatile world.

fields.title: Phasmophobia Devs Prioritize Game Integrity Over Live Service Model
fields.summary: Phasmophobia developers at Kinetic Games clarify they won't adopt live-service mechanics despite community events, focusing instead on completing their roadmap to version 1.0 while maintaining offline playability and seasonal activities.
fields.content:
While some players brave Phasmophobia alone, many enjoy the community-driven horror experience. Recent sightings of Twitch Drops in the game raised questions about expanding seasonal events, but developers have clear boundaries. Lead community manager Tom Dent explained: "We don't want to walk into the live service area. The game is the game, and we have events to bring our year together. We want to steer clear of that vibe while engaging our active community."

In a follow-up discussion, CEO Daniel Knight detailed Kinetic's long-term vision for the ghost-hunting title. "We don't want people expecting indefinite support," Knight stated. "We'll continue for the foreseeable future according to our plan. Our roadmap leads to version 1.0 with regular updates overhauling systems, but post-launch content will focus on additions rather than fundamental changes."

The studio remains open to introducing new ghost types and maps after the 1.0 milestone. However, major reworks of existing mechanics will conclude with the official launch. This approach balances novelty with maintaining the game's core identity.

Offline accessibility remains crucial to the development philosophy. Knight emphasized: "The game can be played offline, so we avoid requiring internet for events. Our current three seasonal activities and Twitch Drops represent the extent of live-service elements we'll implement."

The stance reflects Kinetic's commitment to preserving Phasmophobia's essence without becoming an always-online experience. Though fans might miss themed events like haunted holidays, the team's focused approach maintains weekly challenges and community activities while respecting their creative boundaries.

fields.title: US-Brokered Iran-Israel Ceasefire Under Strain After Violation Claims
fields.summary: The fragile US-mediated ceasefire between Iran and Israel faces challenges as both nations accuse each other of truce violations, prompting President Trump to warn against further escalation after exchange of missile fire.
fields.content:
President Donald Trump has urged Israel against launching additional strikes on Iran, hours after announcing a US and Qatar-brokered ceasefire took effect. Trump used expletives while criticizing both nations for alleged violations after Israel claimed Iran fired missiles post-truce and vowed retaliatory strikes, while Iran denied attacks and threatened responses to any Israeli aggression.

Ceasefire timeline

Trump declared the ceasefire active at 05:00 GMT on Tuesday, imploring both nations not to breach terms. Israel confirmed agreement around 06:00 GMT after Iran signaled conditional compliance. However, Israel later accused Iran of missile launches violating the agreement. Trump had initially announced a "fully agreed" truce around 22:00 GMT Monday night following an Iranian missile strike on a US base in Qatar.

US presidential reaction

Trump explicitly warned Israel: "Do not drop those bombs" in a social media post. Speaking outside the White House, he declared dissatisfaction with Israeli actions, referencing one rocket fired past the deadline: "These guys got to calm down." He later reaffirmed the ceasefire remained operational despite tensions.

Regional responses

The Israel Defense Forces reported missile launches from Iran shortly after agreeing to the ceasefire, prompting Foreign Minister Israel Katz to call it a "complete violation" and order continued military operations against Tehran. Iran's military denied post-ceasefire attacks, though the Revolutionary Guard claimed strikes on Israeli targets moments before truce implementation. Iran's Supreme National Security Council pledged decisive retaliation against any Israeli operations.

Ceasefire violations

Israel alleges post-ceasefire missile attacks from Iran destroyed a radar array near Tehran. Pre-truce violence on Monday night included Israeli strikes killing four people and injuring 22 in Beersheba. Iran acknowledged launching "a last round of missiles" before ceasefire onset, while Tehran residents reported intense air defense activity overnight. Nuclear scientist casualties were also reported before the agreement.

Conflict origins

Israel initiated attacks on Iranian nuclear and military sites on June 13, claiming Iran approached nuclear weapons capability amid stalled diplomatic talks. The offensive responded to international concerns over Iran's uranium enrichment, but no consensus exists on nuclear progress. US forces later joined with strikes on Fordow nuclear site. Iranian health officials reported 610 deaths and 4,746 injuries from Israeli attacks, while Israel confirmed 28 total Israeli deaths.

Nuclear capabilities

Iran maintains all nuclear activities serve peaceful purposes despite UN reports confirming 400kg of uranium enriched to 60% purity—near weapons-grade levels. US officials credit joint strikes with significantly delaying Iran's nuclear ambitions, while Iranian broadcaster Hassan Abedini claimed targeted sites had been emptied prior to bombings.

fields.title: Oil Prices Tumble as Israel and Iran Announce Ceasefire
fields.summary: Global oil prices plunged by nearly 5% following Israel and Iran's ceasefire agreement, easing fears of disrupted energy supplies. The drop narrowed after mutual ceasefire violation accusations emerged, with Brent crude trading at $69.67 as stock markets worldwide rallied.
fields.content:
Oil prices crashed by almost 5% on Tuesday after Israel accepted a ceasefire agreement with Iran, potentially ending a two-week military confrontation. Brent crude initially plummeted to $68 per barrel but partially recovered when both nations quickly accused each other of violating the truce.

Price volatility spiked amid concerns that Iran might disrupt global energy supplies by blocking the Strait of Hormuz, a critical passage for international oil and gas shipments. Prior to the ceasefire, crude had surged to $81 per barrel since missile exchanges began on June 13, fueling inflation concerns worldwide.

Financial markets rallied globally as tensions momentarily eased. In the US, the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average both gained 0.9% while the Nasdaq rose over 1%. European indexes followed suit, with the UK's FTSE 100 up 0.4% and Germany's Dax climbing 1.7%, while Japan's Nikkei closed 1.1% higher.

Market analyst Priyanka Sachdeva of Phillip Nova stated, "If the ceasefire holds as announced, investors might expect oil markets to normalize." She cautioned that price stability hinges on both nations adhering to the truce conditions, adding, "The extent of compliance will significantly influence future oil valuations."

The conflict's energy impacts extended beyond oil, with wholesale UK gas prices dropping 12.5% on Tuesday after earlier spikes. Qatar, a key supplier of liquefied natural gas transporting through Hormuz, remains strategically important after Iran targeted a U.S. base there on Monday.

U.S. President Donald Trump publicly announced the ceasefire implementation, urging Israel on social media to halt military actions following violation allegations. The crisis recalled market turbulence experienced during Russia's Ukraine invasion, raising global concerns about energy cost impacts on consumer goods, transportation, and manufacturing sectors.

fields.title: Starmer Vows to Proceed with Welfare Reforms Despite Labour Rebellion
fields.summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer insists on implementing controversial welfare cuts saving £5bn annually by 2030, despite facing opposition from over 120 Labour MPs who threaten the government's parliamentary majority.
fields.content:
Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer has committed to advancing the government's welfare reforms despite mounting dissent within the Labour Party. More than 120 Labour MPs support blocking proposed cuts to disability and sickness benefits designed to save £5 billion annually by 2030.

The scale of rebellion endangers the government's working majority in Parliament. Speaking before a NATO summit, Starmer called the current welfare system "unsustainable," asserting it traps people in dependency while creating unsustainable taxpayer burdens.

"I intend to press ahead," Starmer declared when asked about reconsidering amid opposition. He highlighted that projected annual growth in Personal Independence Payment (PIP) claimants equals "the population of a city the size of Leicester," demanding critics propose sustainable alternatives. Regarding Conservative support, he dismissed: "I have no idea what they'll do."

'Groundswell of opinion'

The Universal Credit and PIP Bill, scheduled for vote next Tuesday, would restrict disability benefits by toughening eligibility criteria. Rebels filed a "reasoned amendment" to halt the bill, citing concerns over increased poverty risks, insufficient consultation, and inadequate impact assessments.

With over half of Labour backbenchers endorsing the amendment, Dame Meg Hillier—who tabled it—urged the government to acknowledge this "groundswell of opinion." She criticized poor communication causing confusion while affirming welfare reform necessity, but noted exclusion of Labour experts during planning.

An unnamed amendment coordinator revealed that the government's U-turn on winter fuel payments emboldened rebels: "Colleagues think why should I take that grief again?" The rebellion intensified after Work Secretary Liz Kendall extended PIP transition periods from four to thirteen weeks—viewed as insufficient compromise.

Chancellor Rachel Reeves relies on the £5bn savings to meet fiscal rules. The reforms would replace work capability assessments with stricter PIP evaluations requiring proof of greater need for daily-task assistance. PIP claims have surged from 2 million (2019) to 3.7 million today. Despite cuts, disability spending is forecast to rise from £39.1bn to £58.1bn by 2030.

fields.title: England Rolls Out At-Home Cervical Screening Tests
fields.summary: NHS England will provide at-home cervical screening kits from January to boost low testing rates. The HPV self-tests aim to address barriers like embarrassment and accessibility for over 5 million overdue women, with research showing they could increase screening uptake significantly.
fields.content:
Women in England who postponed cervical screenings will soon access home testing kits, NHS England announced. The DIY option aims to reverse low participation rates by offering a convenient alternative to clinic visits.

The kits, launching in January, contain a long cotton swab for vaginal lining sampling. They screen for human papillomavirus (HPV), which causes most cervical cancers. All women aged 25-64 qualify for periodic screenings, yet government data reveals over 5 million are behind schedule.

England's Department for Health stated the program tackles "deeply entrenched barriers" deterring women, including discomfort, time constraints, embarrassment, and cultural sensitivities. Current screening uptake is only 68.8%—far below the NHS's 80% target—with younger women, disabled individuals, ethnic minorities, and LGBT+ groups most likely to miss appointments.

Pilot trials indicated nationwide home testing could raise participation to 77% within three years. The government plans to prioritize kits for women who rarely or never attend screenings. Discreetly packaged with prepaid return postage, the tests exclusively check for HPV. Positive results trigger follow-up exams for precancerous cell changes.

Health Secretary Wes Streeting emphasized: "We know the earlier cancer is diagnosed the better the chances are of survival. By making screening more convenient, we're tackling barriers that keep millions from potentially life-saving tests." Cancer Research UK CEO Michelle Mitchell noted at-home testing "helps bring us closer" to defeating cervical cancer universally.

'I'm absolutely thrilled'

Hazel Stinson, a 49-year-old from Kent with chronic fatigue syndrome (ME), last screened six years ago. She expressed being "absolutely thrilled" about the initiative: "This means I and millions like me can get tested when otherwise we couldn't."

Stinson highlighted the necessity of self-advocacy with chronic illness but feared health consequences from missed appointments: "I'm unwell enough already—I don't want anything else on top."

Separately, NHS England adjusted screening intervals: women aged 25-49 testing HPV-negative will now wait five years instead of three for rechecks. Research confirms this group faces minimal cervical cancer risk.

fields.title: King Charles Sends Historic Midwinter Message to Antarctic Researchers
fields.summary: King Charles has marked a royal first by recording a special message to Antarctic scientists during the continent's Midwinter celebrations, praising their vital research on climate change and offering warm wishes during the sunless polar winter.
fields.content:
King Charles has made history by sending a personal message to researchers in Antarctica for Midwinter Day, becoming the first monarch to participate in the annual broadcast tradition that has continued for seven decades. His address specifically recognized scientists monitoring climate change impacts from remote outposts during Antarctica's harshest season.

The Antarctic Midwinter Broadcast, now celebrating its 70th anniversary, aims to boost morale in isolated stations enduring extreme winter conditions. The King emphasized the global significance of their work, stating: "Each observation, measurement and calculation you undertake adds to the world's understanding of Earth's fragile systems."

Alex Rootes, leader of the UK's Rothera research base, expressed profound appreciation for the royal recognition. He described the honor of conducting work "at the cutting edge of science in a really difficult part of the world", a sentiment echoing through the Antarctic community as they experience continuous darkness and heavy snowfall during midwinter.

While the UK enjoys summer warmth, researchers face complete darkness with temperatures currently around -2°C. Charles noted this contrast, stating: "With the sun shying away from your horizon today, I particularly wanted to send my warmest good wishes." He applauded their "critically important work" in studying ice changes that reveal humanity's relationship with nature.

As a lifelong environmental advocate, the King acknowledged the team's "resilience and commitment" to tracking climate shifts through ice core analysis spanning millennia. His participation marks a milestone for the broadcast, which previously featured figures such as Sir David Attenborough and entertainer Bill Bailey through its seven-decade history.

The British Antarctic Survey, which Charles praised for telling "stories of the past, present and possible futures", describes Antarctica as a crucial environmental barometer. Scientists across multiple stations are analyzing prehistoric climate patterns within ice cores while monitoring contemporary ecological shifts.

Rootes is among 41 researchers stationed at Rothera, located over a thousand miles from the nearest hospital. He noted that despite relatively mild temperatures, the psychological challenges of perpetual darkness make communal Midwinter celebrations crucial for mental health. "At this time of year when darkness has closed in, it's very easy psychologically for people to withdraw into themselves," he explained.

Midwinter traditions mirror a June Christmas with gift exchanges, festive meals, and the peculiar annual screening of the sci-fi horror film 'The Thing'. A 10km fun run may occur if conditions permit. The broadcast offers connection to families through recorded messages and familiar music, with Rootes emphasizing that the King's participation validates their climate monitoring: "It's lovely to feel recognized in this remote community while conducting this vital research."

fields.title: Glastonbury Spotlight: 5 Rising Acts You Need to See
fields.summary: While headliners dominate Glastonbury headlines, this year's festival offers breakthrough talents poised to steal the spotlight. Meet five exciting newcomers – from sharp-witted British songwriters to high-energy Argentine fusionists – performing across Worthy Farm's stages before their inevitable rise to stardom.
fields.content:
While major Glastonbury headliners like Rod Stewart, Charli XCX, Neil Young, and Olivia Rodrigo claim attention, significant buzz also surrounds mystery "TBA" slots sparking rumors about surprise appearances.

Yet the festival's magic often lies in discovering emerging artists destined for greatness. This year offers exceptional opportunities to witness breakthrough talent across multiple stages before they soar.

1) Alessi Rose: A pop queen on the brink of stardom

Alessi Rose shifted from playing intimate venues to opening for Dua Lipa before 70,000 people in Milan within days. The 22-year-old Derby native crafts confessional pop through self-written and self-produced tracks building a devoted following since her 2023 debut single.

"It's such a close-knit community," Rose notes about fans who witnessed her songwriting evolution. Her literature background shines in sharp storytelling lyrics like newest single That Could Be Me - capturing anguish over missed romantic chances with the line, "I missed every shot / And they ricocheted, now they're lodged in my brain."

Opening Saturday's Other Stage, Rose promises an unforgettable set: "There's not gonna be a chill bone in my body. My mum cried when I told her - she knows this is my dream festival."

2) MRCY's sun-baked soul anthems

Soul duo MRCY combines Kojo Degraft-Johnson's powerhouse vocals with Barney Lister's production expertise honed working with artists like Joy Crookes. Their expansive sound blends 1970s soul influences with contemporary social commentary.

"When the world's gone crazy, soul music is a good escape," notes Lister. Their song Man addresses modern masculinity over funky Afro-beats, promoting positivity: "We should lead with light." Championed by Elton John and Rolling Stone as "destined for greatness," Degraft-Johnson confirms their mission: "We've put a lot of love into our music."

3) Drum & bass thrill-seekers Koven

Koven's Katie Boyle revolutionizes drum & bass performances by dynamically shifting between DJ decks and stage-front vocals using custom equipment. "I practice like crazy," she explains, detailing rigorous rehearsals synchronizing mixes by running to sing in other rooms.

This dedication earned Koven a prime Saturday night Lonely Hearts Stage slot. Recalling their challenging 2022 performance against Diana Ross, Boyle laughingly requests audiences bring photos of happy dogs - a long-ignored rider item that delights her when fulfilled.

4) Ca7riel and Paco Amoroso's irreverent Latin fusion

Argentinian duo Ca7riel and Paco Amoroso saw unprecedented success after their NPR Tiny Desk concert crossed them from Buenos Aires locals to global acts, increasing Spotify streams from 3,000 to 220,000 daily. Their set merges trap, rock, electronica and Latin jazz with high-octane spontaneity.

Despite mainstream pressures to "go pop," they maintained their irreverent style. "We get bored easily," they explain of their unpredictable sets. Glastonbury's Friday West Holts performance offers them post-show exploration of the site: "People told us it's a 72-hour party - that's our thing."

5) Gurriers: Sharp, melodic punk from Dublin

Daniel Hoff of Dublin punks Gurriers channels generational frustration into visceral performances: "We're loud and abrasive, but you're gonna have a good time." Alongside Ireland's new wave including Fontaines DC and CMAT, they explore societal pressures with disco-influenced rhythms from Pierce O'Callaghan's drumming.

While negotiating a nerve-wracking Saturday discussion with idol Billy Bragg, Hoff promises intensity for their Sunday Woodsies show despite pre-show restraint: "I'll be on non-alcoholics all Saturday."

fields.title: Oblivion Remastered Mod Adds Fallout 4-Style Settlement Building Without Official Support
fields.summary: Modders have created a Fallout 4-inspired settlement building system for The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered within two months of launch, despite Bethesda not providing official modding tools for the RPG remake.
fields.content:
Despite the absence of an official creation kit from Bethesda, Oblivion Remastered modders have accomplished remarkable feats since the RPG's launch. Within just two months, the community has developed significant modifications, including methods to extend Dark Brotherhood questlines and integrate Lua scripting support.

The latest breakthrough is a Fallout 4-inspired settlement building mod aptly titled "Oblivion Settlement Building – Spawn and Place Objects". This mod enables players to generate and position objects throughout the game world, offering god-like creation abilities. As demonstrated on Nexus Mods, users can place massive structures like walls, boulders, and support beams across locations such as Skingrad.

Currently the mod remains functionally basic, lacking systems for managing inhabitants, resources like water, or trade economies. Mod creator MadAborModding candidly expressed hopes that others would expand upon this framework: "I hope someone develops this into a full settlement system. My goal is to bait someone into making that mod since I don't want to build it myself."

The achievement showcases modders' determination to overcome technical limitations. To use the mod, players must install the Unreal Engine Scripting System and place files in OblivionRemastered's directory. This accomplishment comes alongside other recent mods created without official tools since Oblivion Remastered's release.

fields.title: Venice Activists Hail Victory as Bezos Relocates Wedding Away From City Center
fields.summary: Protest groups in Venice declared an 'enormous victory' after Jeff Bezos moved his high-profile wedding celebration away from the historic city center following activist pressure. The Amazon founder's festivities, expected to draw celebrities and private jets, relocated from Scuola Grande della Misericordia to Arsenale amid protests over mass tourism, wealth inequality, and environmental concerns.
fields.content:
Venetian activists are celebrating what they call a significant triumph after billionaire Jeff Bezos and his wedding entourage changed locations for their main celebrations, moving away from Venice's central historic district. The unexpected shift comes after intense demonstrations against the lavish event planned for the Amazon founder and television personality Lauren Sanchez.

The Venue Change

While the original venues for the three-day wedding celebration were never officially confirmed, local sources revealed the Saturday celebration had been scheduled for the prestigious Scuola Grande della Misericordia. A Venetian official confirmed the event will now take place at the Arsenale, located further from the city's crowded center.

Protest Voices

Activist Tommaso Cacciari from the group 'No Space for Bezos' expressed triumph: 'We are very proud! We're just citizens who started organising and we managed to move one of the most powerful people in the world out of the city.' Greenpeace campaigner Simona Abbate added, 'This isn't just a wedding, it's a display of unsustainable excess while others face climate emergencies.'

The star-studded event is expected to host approximately 200 guests including Kim Kardashian, Mick Jagger, Leonardo DiCaprio, and members of the Trump family, with private jets reportedly overwhelming Venice's airport and luxury yachts dominating the harbor. Five hotels have been fully booked, with former US Marines rumored to provide security.

Official Response

City Councillor Simone Venturini criticized protesters as 'a tiny minority,' defending the wedding's economic benefits: 'This involves carefully selected guests and benefits the city. These protesters behave as if they own Venice, but no one gets to decide who marries here.' Venturini noted all events occur in privately owned venues.

Venice's Struggles

The protest movement highlights Venice's battle with over-tourism that prices residents out and climate threats endangering the lagoon city. Despite a five-euro daily tourist tax implemented to curb overcrowding, activists report no reduction in visitors. Original plans for canal blockades using inflatable alligators were canceled, but projections and a Saturday protest march remain scheduled.

'Bezos treats Venice like a theme park for billionaires,' Cacciari remarked, emphasizing concerns about transforming public spaces into private playgrounds for the ultra-wealthy. Multiple groups joined demonstrations, including climate activists and critics of Bezos' support for Donald Trump, with banners draped across canals calling for wealth taxation.

fields.title: Asos Bans Shoppers Over Excessive Returns, Sparking Customer Backlash
fields.summary: Online fashion retailer Asos has banned numerous customers for high return rates, sparking outrage among shoppers. The company cited breaches of its fair use policy, which targets unusual returns patterns, after previously introducing a £3.95 returns fee. Affected customers share their frustration while experts explain retailers' growing crackdown on returns due to unsustainable costs.
fields.content:
Asos customers have voiced outrage after having their accounts abruptly closed for returning too many orders. In recent days, numerous shoppers received emails notifying them of bans for allegedly violating the online retailer's fair use policy. This follows Asos's controversial introduction last year of a £3.95 return fee for customers who frequently send back items.

A company spokesperson stated: "We recently closed the accounts of a small group of customers whose shopping activity has consistently fallen outside our fair use policy. This helps us maintain our commitment to offering free returns to all customers across all core markets." The policy allows account deactivation for unusual returns patterns or items appearing worn.

Lucy Britnell, a long-term customer from Teesside, invested heavily in Asos products before her ban. She spent approximately £100 monthly, with her recent holiday shopping reaching £500. "I usually order two sizes because Asos sizing is unpredictable," she explained. After receiving her ban notice, Asos simultaneously requested to feature her outfit photo on Instagram. "It felt like a slap in the face," Lucy remarked, adding she'd switch retailers even if reinstated.

London PR director Frankie Allen experienced similar treatment after 20 years as a customer. Her attempts to explain she ordered multiple sizes for fit were dismissed during live chats she shared with the BBC. She criticized Asos's "robotic communications" for alienating loyal shoppers despite acknowledging some customers abuse return policies. Retail expert Medi Parry-Williams emphasized that return processing costs often exceed the £3.95 fee, calling the practice unsustainable.

Louise Gowrie from Glasgow described being abruptly disconnected twice when challenging her ban via Asos's chat system. Retail analyst John Stevenson noted account closures represent an extreme measure retailers wouldn't take lightly. Following a post-lockdown returns surge, competitors like Next, Zara, and H&M introduced postal return fees while maintaining free in-store returns.

Broadcaster Tskenya-Sarah Frazer started an online petition against the bans after losing access as a plus-size, tall, neurodivergent shopper. "Online shopping is my only option," she stressed. "Customers must have freedom to shop and return freely as high streets shrink." Asos declined further comment on the bans, as affected customers demand policy changes.

fields.title: US Leaked Report Raises Questions on Extent of Iran Nuclear Site Damage
fields.summary: A leaked US defense assessment suggests recent strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities caused months-long setbacks rather than permanent destruction, with satellite imagery and intelligence indicating uranium stocks were potentially relocated while damage to sensitive centrifuges remains uncertain.
fields.content:
The Fordow nuclear facility represents one of the most intensively monitored sites globally, with Western intelligence agencies closely tracking it since its secret functions were exposed in 2009. Understanding the true impact of recent US strikes here proves crucial for predicting the next phase of regional tensions.

A leaked Defense Intelligence Agency report notes that core components of Iran's nuclear program likely survived the attacks, suggesting the damage represents a setback of months rather than years. This preliminary evaluation carries a "low confidence" rating due to difficulties in assessing the deeply buried facility.

As the Pentagon's military-focused intelligence branch, the DIA specializes in operational support but differs from agencies like the CIA in methodology. Joint Chiefs Chairman General Dan Caine cautioned that determining "final battle damage will take some time" following the strikes.

Satellite images revealing surface craters provide limited insight into underground effects, showing no major structural collapse at Fordow. This suggests Iran's reinforced concrete defenses may have shielded critical chambers from the newly deployed bombs designed to penetrate fortified sites.

The ultra-sensitive centrifuges, essential for enriching uranium, remain vulnerable despite structural protections. Explosions near these high-speed spinning machines could have knocked them off-axis through sheer physical disruption, creating cascading failures.

Ultimate damage assessment requires diverse intelligence streams beyond satellites. Analysts deploy seismic sensors to measure blast depth, radiation detectors to identify leaks, and LIDAR technology generating 3D underground maps. Human sources and intercepted communications also prove vital for understanding Iranian repair efforts.

Even significant damage at sites like Fordo doesn't eliminate Iran's nuclear potential, as capabilities could be reconstituted elsewhere. Satellite sightings of truck convoctions just before the attack suggest possible relocation of nuclear materials.

Evidence indicates Tehran moved stockpiles of highly enriched uranium to alternate sites, with analysts monitoring another fortified mountain complex identified as "Pickaxe." While some centrifuges might have been relocated, limited movement appears insufficient to maintain pre-strike enrichment timelines.

Long-term nuclear weapon development faces persistent challenges regardless of current damage. Weaponization requires highly specialized expertise—knowledge diminished by Israel's earlier targeted killings of Iranian nuclear scientists. Development of functional delivery systems presents another complex hurdle.

The attacks undoubtedly delayed Iran's nuclear progress, though the specific timeline remains speculative. Intelligence agencies worldwide now intensify monitoring, aware that evidence of Tehran secretly accelerating its program could reignite military confrontation.

fields.title: Trump Disputes Report on Limited Impact of Iran Nuclear Strikes
fields.summary: President Trump and senior U.S. officials have rejected a leaked intelligence assessment suggesting American airstrikes on Iranian nuclear facilities only set back Tehran's program by months. The administration claims the attacks caused decades of damage, while defense officials question the report's credibility and announce an FBI leak investigation.
fields.content:
President Donald Trump has countered a leaked intelligence report indicating that recent U.S. airstrikes against Iran made limited impact on its nuclear capabilities. Speaking at a NATO summit in The Hague, Trump asserted the bombings resulted in the "virtual obliteration" of Iran's nuclear program, setting it back "by decades" rather than months.

Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, appearing alongside Trump and Secretary of State Marco Rubio, dismissed the preliminary Pentagon assessment as "completely false" and based on "low confidence" intelligence. He stated the FBI is investigating the source of the leak and characterized it as politically motivated. "The bombs landed precisely where they were supposed to," Hegseth emphasized.

Disputed Damage Assessment

According to sources familiar with the leaked Defense Intelligence Agency report, U.S. strikes last Saturday targeted three Iranian nuclear sites—Fordo, Natanz, and Isfahan—using specialized "bunker buster" munitions. The assessment indicates the attacks sealed off entrances and damaged surface infrastructure, but failed to destroy critical underground structures housing enrichment equipment.

The report suggests Iran's enriched uranium stockpile largely survived the strikes, with centrifuges remaining "intact" underground. Deputy coordinator Hassan Abedini of Iran's state broadcaster supported this view, claiming targeted facilities had been evacuated beforehand and nuclear materials moved elsewhere.

Ongoing Disagreements

Trump initially acknowledged intelligence was "very inconclusive" before doubling down on his high-impact claims at the NATO meeting, controversially comparing the strikes to the World War Two atomic bombings of Hiroshima. Secretary Rubio similarly questioned the leaked report, labeling its sources as "professional stabbers."

Defense officials clarified that "low confidence" signifies preliminary findings subject to change. However, General Dan Caine, chairman of the joint chiefs, had originally reported "extremely severe damage" at all three sites. Satellite images revealed multiple craters at Fordo facility, though sub-surface destruction remains indeterminate.

fields.title: UK Households Owe £8 Billion in Unpaid Council Tax as Bills Set to Rise
fields.summary: Households across the UK now owe over £8 billion in unpaid council tax, with new arrears growing rapidly as the Treasury indicates bills will keep increasing by 5% annually, sparking calls for debt collection reforms.
fields.content:
Billions remain unpaid in council tax as financially strained households struggle with mounting debts while facing the prospect of further tax hikes. New figures show £6.6 billion owed to English local authorities, including an additional £642 million accumulated during the last financial year.

Combined with £1.5 billion owed in Scotland and £160 million in Wales, the total unpaid council tax across these nations now exceeds £8 billion. This figure represents double the amount of outstanding household energy debts and continues to grow amid cost-of-living pressures.

Falling behind

While councils collected £41.2 billion in council tax during the year ending April - a 7.2% increase from the previous period - cumulative arrears grew at nearly double that rate, rising by 11%. Charity Debt Justice has criticized bailiff-led approaches to debt recovery, stating this disproportionately harms low-income households.

"People in council tax arrears are overwhelmingly on low incomes, and many are living in poverty," said Toby Murray from Debt Justice. "Rather than help, councils are sending in the bailiffs - punishing people for struggling with their bills. Councils should end the use of bailiffs for council tax debt collection."

The government has announced proposals for debt collection reforms, including capping court-related fees for arrears and changing rules that allow councils to demand full-year payments after three late installments. Ministers also plan to shift toward default 12-month payment schedules rather than the current 10-payment models.

Chief Treasury Secretary Darren Jones told Parliament that officials are anticipating 5% annual council tax increases moving forward, responding "We are doing that, yes" when asked about potential hikes. Local authorities may exceed this cap through referendums or government approval.

The Local Government Association appealed for better central funding rather than reliance on tax hikes, warning that without proper support "it is almost inevitable that bills will continue to be forced up for those who can least afford to pay."

What to do if you can't pay

Charities strongly advise against ignoring council tax demands and encourage people to seek immediate guidance. Citizens Advice recommends contacting local authorities directly to discuss payment arrangements and asking about potential support systems or reductions available to those struggling financially.

fields.title: Labour Welfare Vote Proceeds Despite Major Rebellion
fields.summary: Deputy Prime Minister Angela Rayner confirms the government will proceed with a crucial welfare reform vote on Tuesday despite facing opposition from over 130 Labour MPs demanding the bill be scrapped, setting the stage for a potential parliamentary defeat.
fields.content:
Deputy Prime Minister Angela Rayner has announced that Tuesday's parliamentary vote on the government's welfare reforms will proceed as scheduled, despite facing significant opposition from within her own party. More than 130 MPs, including 120 Labour backbenchers, have endorsed an amendment calling for the complete scrapping of the proposed measures, creating potential for an embarrassing government defeat.

Ministers including the Chancellor and Health Secretary have been actively lobbying MPs to withdraw their opposition. During Commons exchanges, shadow chancellor Sir Mel Stride challenged Rayner to defend the bill and justify why numerous Labour colleagues oppose it.

Rayner countered that the legislation would help people transition into employment while eliminating reassessments for severely disabled benefit recipients. "We won't walk away and stand by and abandon millions of people trapped in a failing system left behind by him and his colleagues," she declared, accusing Conservatives of having "no plans and no idea" on welfare policy.

The Universal Credit and Personal Independence Payment Bill would alter qualification criteria for disability and sickness benefits. Government officials maintain these changes are essential to slow the growth of benefit claims. Labour opponents argue the reforms lack proper impact assessments and warn they risk pushing substantial numbers into poverty.

Conservative leader Kemi Badenoch indicated potential support if the government guarantees welfare budget reductions and increased employment without tax hikes—conditions unlikely to be met. The bill dominated Prime Minister's Questions, where Rayner and Stride stood in for leaders attending NATO meetings.

When Stride speculated about a possible vote cancellation to avoid defeat, Rayner responded unequivocally: "We will go ahead on Tuesday." Stride referenced the government's recent U-turn on winter fuel payments and renewed his offer for Conservative support in exchange for welfare spending reductions.

Rayner rebuffed these overtures by attacking Stride's tenure as work and pensions secretary, stating: "He demands a programme to help people into work... after he left one in eight young people out of the economy." As lobbying intensifies, only one Labour MP—Samantha Niblett—has withdrawn from the rebellion.

During questioning, Liberal Democrat deputy leader Daisy Cooper sought guarantees that nobody would lose benefits before a Carer's Allowance overpayment review concludes, affecting 134,000 caregivers. Rayner responded that government was "taking steps" on the issue.

fields.title: Speech Issues in Children Linked to Mental Health Risks, Study Reveals
fields.summary: Children experiencing speech and language difficulties face significantly higher risks of developing anxiety, depression and other mental health challenges, according to a new report from charity Speech and Language UK that reveals 45% of young people in mental health services struggle with communication problems.
fields.content:
A new study warns that children battling speech and language challenges are increasingly vulnerable to mental health disorders. Charity Speech and Language UK reports that 45% of young people referred to mental health services experience serious communication issues including vocabulary deficits, trouble understanding non-verbal cues, or speech fluency problems.

With a record two million UK children currently facing speech and language difficulties, and one in five children aged 8-25 experiencing mental health problems in 2023, experts express deep concern. Jane Harris, chief executive of Speech and Language UK, notes: "Everyone uses words to identify feelings. If you're struggling with language, you can't say 'I'm sad, I'm angry.' This inability to articulate emotions creates fertile ground for mental health struggles to take root."

Spotlight on Communication Disorders

For approximately one million young people across the UK, communication difficulties become lifelong challenges due to conditions like cerebral palsy, autism, hearing impairments or developmental language disorder (DLD). This neurological condition affects around 800,000 people, causing persistent difficulties expressing thoughts or comprehending language.

The charity urges systemic changes including mandatory speech and language training for teachers, mental health professionals and school support staff. Their joint report with the Centre for Mental Health advocates moving beyond talk-based therapies in some cases, suggesting alternatives like art therapy for those with communication barriers.

A Personal Struggle with Speech Barriers

Siouxsie, a 19-year-old with DLD and selective mutism, shares her experience: "All my mental health struggles intertwine with severe language difficulties. Basic interactions in restaurants, shops or group settings become exhausting as I constantly process language." Unable to vocalize her needs as a child due to inadequate support, she now finds social situations anxiety-inducing and relies on dance as a creative outlet.

Systemic Changes Proposed

The UK government highlights ongoing programs including the Nuffield Early Language Intervention scheme for reception-year children and plans to embed communication support specialists in educational settings. A spokesperson noted expansion of mental health support teams to reach 900,000 more students by 2026, stating: "We're reforming systems to prioritize early intervention so every child can thrive."

fields.title: Enigmacursor: New Dog-Sized Dinosaur Species Discovered Beneath Giants
fields.summary: A dinosaur previously misclassified as a Nanosaurus has been identified as a new species named Enigmacursor – meaning 'puzzling runner' – that lived 150 million years ago alongside giants like Stegosaurus. The labrador-sized fossil, the first new dinosaur exhibited at London's Natural History Museum since 2014, offers crucial insights into dinosaur evolution through its near-complete skeleton.
fields.content:
Scientists have confirmed that a dinosaur specimen originally categorized as a common species is actually a distinct new type, now named Enigmacursor (meaning "puzzling runner"). This dog-sized creature lived approximately 150 million years ago, moving among the feet of massive dinosaurs including Stegosaurus in what is now the western United States.

Previously classified as a Nanosaurus, researchers re-examined the fossil and determined it represents an entirely different species. It will be unveiled to the public at London's Natural History Museum, marking their first new permanent dinosaur display since 2014.

Measuring 64 cm tall and 180 cm long – comparable to a labrador but with relatively larger feet and a remarkably long tail – Enigmacursor represents a significant find. According to Professor Susannah Maidment, its small head suggests limited intelligence, and fossil evidence indicates it was likely an adolescent when it died.

Conservators meticulously assembled the skeleton for display. Lu Allington-Jones emphasized caution during the delicate mounting process: "I don't want to damage it at this stage before it's revealed to everybody." Colleague Kieran Miles noted anatomical features revealing its lifestyle: "Solid dense hips show it was a fast runner, while smaller front limbs may have been used to gather plants."

The scientific breakthrough came through detailed bone analysis. Researchers discovered crucial differences in leg bones that distinguished it from the Nanosaurus designation. Investigations revealed that the original Nanosaurus reference specimen wasn't identifiable – merely "a rock with some impressions of bone" that "could be any number of dinosaurs," according to Maidment.

This led to the dissolution of the problematic Nanosaurus classification. Professor Paul Barrett explained the broader significance: "Specimens like this fill gaps in our knowledge, showing how evolutionary changes occurred gradually over time." The well-preserved skeleton helps scientists understand how early small dinosaurs eventually diversified into enormous descendants.

Complete small dinosaur fossils are rare since larger specimens historically received more attention during excavations. Barrett expressed hope the discovery will inspire more focus during digs: "When looking for big dinosaurs, it's easy to overlook smaller ones. Now I hope people will keep their eyes close to the ground."

Enigmacursor's importance extends beyond identification. Maidment stresses taxonomic accuracy is foundational: "If we've got species classification wrong, everything else falls apart." Researchers believe other fossils previously labeled Nanosaurus may represent additional distinct species awaiting recognition.

The findings formally identifying Enigmacursor mollyborthwickae as a new species appear in the journal Royal Society Open Science. The fossil will be permanently displayed alongside the museum's Stegosaurus Sophie specimen from the same geological formation.

fields.title: Three UK Hit by Voice Call Outage, Data Services Unaffected
fields.summary: The UK mobile operator Three is experiencing a voice service disruption preventing some customers from making calls, though data services remain operational. Downdetector logged over 9,000 reports as providers using Three's network confirmed the issue, while Vodafone services remain unaffected following their recent merger.
fields.content:
UK mobile network Three has confirmed that multiple customers are currently unable to make phone calls due to a voice service disruption. The company acknowledged the problem on social media platform X, citing "an issue affecting voice services" but hasn't specified how many of its 11 million UK subscribers are impacted.

Outage tracking service Downdetector recorded a sharp spike in reports around 09:30 BST on Wednesday, with over 9,000 user notifications received about call failures. Three clarified that data services including 4G and 5G connectivity continue to function normally throughout the disruption.

This outage affects the UK's largest mobile network formed by Three's recent merger with Vodafone, which consolidated approximately 27 million customers. While Vodafone services are operating normally, other operators relying on Three's infrastructure – including ID Mobile and Smarty – reported similar voice service problems.

ID Mobile advised customers via its service status page that technical teams are "working hard with our network partner Three UK to fix this issue," promising full service restoration as soon as possible. Smarty similarly confirmed awareness of the voice service disruption and ongoing repair efforts.

Affected customers shared difficulties reaching critical services on social media, with reports including missed hospital callbacks and disabled vehicle recovery services. Although some users reported data outages Wednesday morning, Three maintains all data systems are "working normally." This follows a January incident where Three investigated emergency call failures during a prior network disruption.

fields.title: Rod Stewart Expresses Discontent Over Glastonbury 'Tea Time' Slot Label
fields.summary: Rock legend Rod Stewart, 80, discusses his upcoming Glastonbury performance in the 'legends' slot, voicing displeasure with the 'tea time' label and sharing insights on his career, memorable performances, vocal origins, wild youth, and current family-focused life ahead of a new greatest hits release.
fields.content:
Rod Stewart has criticized the labeling of Glastonbury's coveted 'legends' performance as the 'tea time slot,' commenting it evokes images of 'pipe and slippers'. The 80-year-old musician successfully negotiated a 90-minute set after initially being offered 75 minutes for his Pyramid Stage appearance. "I'm not gonna make any announcements between songs. I'll do one number, shout 'next', and go straight into the next one," Stewart explained, determined to maximize song selections despite usually performing over two-hour shows.

Career Reflections and Past Glastonbury Experience

Stewart's extensive catalog includes classics like 'Maggie May,' 'Do Ya Think I'm Sexy?' and 'Sailing.' His last Glastonbury show in 2002 won over initially wary crowds despite being billed alongside acts like The White Stripes. Remarkably, Stewart confesses no memory of the performance: "I do so many concerts, they all blend into one." One unforgettable show was his 1994 Copacabana Beach performance for 3 million people, where he performed despite severe food poisoning. "I was violently sick... I didn't think I was going to make it," he recalled.

Signature Style and Career Origins

Known for his spiked blonde hair, Stewart debunked the myth of using mayonnaise for styling: "I used to use sugared hot water." His distinctive raspy voice made him one of rock's great interpreters, though he was initially discovered for harmonica skills in 1964 by Long John Baldry. "I wanted to always sound like Sam Cooke and Otis Redding," he shared. Early fame came with Jeff Beck Group and the Faces, whose hotel destruction tactics included charging $11,000 (£54,000 today) in damages while booking under Fleetwood Mac's name.

Personal Life and Current Priorities

Stewart acknowledged past womanizing contributed to failed relationships with Britt Ekland, Alana Stewart, and Kelly Emberg. His divorce from Rachel Hunter in 1999 left him heartbroken: "I felt cold all the time... distracted almost to the point of madness." Since 2007, he's been happily married to Penny Lancaster, with whom he renewed vows in 2023. The couple recently celebrated their anniversary aboard the Orient Express. Stewart now prioritizes family, saying of his eight children: "I'll wake up... and see all these messages... it's gorgeous." His new greatest hits album—his 20th—accompanies his Glastonbury appearance, which he approaches without concern for critics: "I'm there to entertain my people."

fields.title: Man convicted of murdering teen with sword in London attack
fields.summary: Marcus Monzo has been found guilty of murdering 14-year-old Daniel Anjorin with a samurai sword during an attack in Hainault, northeast London, last year. He was also convicted on multiple charges including attempted murder as the case remains under active development.
fields.content:
A London court has convicted Marcus Monzo for murdering schoolboy Daniel Anjorin, 14, during a sword attack in the Hainault district last year. The attacker used a samurai-style blade in the assault that shocked the local community.

Jurors found Monzo guilty on three counts of attempted murder along with charges of wounding with intent and possessing an offensive weapon. The attacks occurred during the same violent incident that killed the teenager.

Authorities confirm this remains a developing case with additional details expected to emerge. Officials urged the public to await formal updates as the judicial process continues.

fields.title: Turtle Beach Stealth 600 Gen 3 Tops Mid-Range Headsets with Balanced Performance
fields.summary: The Turtle Beach Stealth 600 Gen 3 gaming headset has become the top mid-range wireless recommendation with its $100 price point offering premium features like 2.4GHz wireless, Bluetooth 5.2, flip-to-mute mic, and impressive audio quality — all packaged in a versatile design suitable for both gaming and daily use.
fields.content:
The Turtle Beach Stealth 600 gaming headset has reached its peak performance with the third generation release, securing the top mid-range wireless recommendation. Priced at $100, this headset delivers premium features typically reserved for higher-cost models including a reliable 2.4GHz wireless connection via included dongle plus Bluetooth 5.2 for on-the-go usability. Its sleek build houses a convenient flip-to-mute microphone that neatly retracts into the left earcup, allowing for subtle public wear when not gaming.

Testers noted exceptionally comfortable memory foam earpads during extended gaming sessions, though those with smaller heads might desire more padding in the headband. Audio performance impressed with warm, detailed sound reproduction across frequencies, striking an exceptional balance for its price tier. While not competing with premium $300+ audiophile models, the Stealth 600’s 40mm drivers deliver clear competitive gaming audio alongside rich entertainment immersion.

The combination of wireless versatility, microphone clarity, form-fitting comfort and stylish aesthetics establishes this as the definitive mid-range gaming headset champion. For alternatives across various budgets and priorities, below are the top headsets we've tested:

The best gaming headsets

1. Best overall: HyperX Cloud Alpha

The HyperX Cloud Alpha continues to dominate as the best overall gaming headset, offering stellar bass-rich audio, reliable build quality, professional-grade microphone clarity, and exceptional all-day comfort at an accessible price point.

2. Best budget: Corsair HS55 Stereo

As the top budget pick, the Corsair HS55 Stereo improves upon its predecessor with enhanced comfort and audio fidelity. Its no-frills design includes memory foam ear cushions and a flip-up mic while delivering crisp stereo sound perfect for value-conscious gamers.

3. Best wireless: HyperX Cloud Alpha Wireless

Reigning as the best wireless option, the Cloud Alpha Wireless provides impeccable audio definition, DTS surround compatibility, clear microphone transmission, and an astonishing 300-hour battery life within a lightweight and comfortable build ideal for marathon gaming.

4. Best mid-range wireless: Turtle Beach Stealth 600 Gen 3

Our premier mid-range wireless selection balances impressive sound quality, dual-connection versatility, extended battery life and refined design without exceeding a $100 budget — requiring only minimal additional headband padding for smaller users.

5. Best wired audiophile: Beyerdynamic MMX 330 Pro

For unmatched wired audiophile performance, these headphones feature precision craftsmanship and velvety comfort ideal for extended gaming. Their refined audio profile delivers warm tones, rich bass, and crystal-clear mids that satisfy critical listeners.

6. Best wireless audiophile: Audeze Maxwell

The Audeze Maxwell establishes the pinnacle of wireless audiophile experiences with groundbreaking planar magnetic drivers that generate studio-grade sound quality whether gaming or enjoying music, all wrapped in a premium build.

7. Best for streaming: Audio-Technica ATH-M50xSTS StreamSet

Designed specifically for streamers, this hybrid headset replaces traditional desktop microphone setups with industry-leading vocal capture and monitoring capabilities through professional-grade components built for broadcast-quality audio.

8. Best noise cancelling: AceZone A-Spire

Featuring specialized gaming-optimized ANC, these headphones excel at eliminating environmental noise to achieve deeper immersion in gameplay regardless of external distractions.
